Posts.Content: Apr 29, 2013 09:42AM savvy107 wrote: It's terribly scary and I guess I've found the best thing I can do right now is consume my time with other activities the best I can.  I've also been very open with my lump discovery with my friends and family because their support really does help me.  My doctor said it's generally a good thing when they don't find anything in the ultrasound, and that she wants me to wear a tight bra, take vitamin E, and have no caffeine for the next couple of weeks, leaning toward the idea that my lumps are from fibrocystic changes, and if the lumps don't go away or shrink then she is referring me to a breast surgeon for a second opinion, as she seemed almost a little surprised the ultrasound didn't show anything.  Trying to stay positive.  I have just bad premonitions about these lumps, they do not feel like the typical lumps I discover when around my menstrual cycle.
Posts.Title: 2 lumps found in left breast, having a hard time staying calm savvy107 Skigirl72

Posts.Content: Apr 26, 2013 05:22AM - edited Apr 26, 2013 05:23AM by savvy107 I had the ultrasound done today, and the radiologist said that absolutely nothing showed up on sonogram.  =/  I'm not 100% reassured by this news, because  the lumps are obviously there, and can be felt by both my doctor and I.  I'm not really sure what to do from here, I believe I will call my doctor and make a follow up appointment.  These lumps do not feel normal to me whatsoever, nothing like the normal fibrocystic lumps I sometimes feel.  If it were a tumor or cyst of some sort, shouldn't it show up on the ultrasound?
Posts.Title: 2 lumps found in left breast, having a hard time staying calm savvy107 Skigirl72

Posts.Content: savvy107 wrote: Hello all,  I just figured I would try and post here to hopefully receive some feedback to calm my nerves a bit.  I'm 20 years old, and had discovered a small marble sized, hard lump in my left breast right under the areola of my nipple.   It seems to move around and be smooth edged, so it seems as though this is a good sign as far as not being cancerous.  I went to get an exam, and my doctor scared me by saying she felt the mass deeper into my breast.  She also told me I have fibrocystic breasts.  Finally, she found a second lump, lower in my breast, that feels quite large to me, however I cannot even really point it out when I examine myself, as it just feels similar to all of the other lumpy tissue in my breast.  The lumps both generally painless, however my boobs have been incredibly swollen and slightly tender.  My mensis also just began, so I'm not sure whether to account the swelling from that, or the lumps.   I'm going for an ultrasound friday, but I can't lie, I'm quite scared and anxious about the whole thing.  I almost wish the lumps were sore, and squishier, so I could be better able to believe they're just cysts.  I keep trying to remind myself that chances are slim that I could have cancer so young, but it isn't entirely impossible.  My grandmother's mother had breast cancer, but that is the only person as far as i know in my family.   I'm feeling really anxious, and I suppose I just need some advice and support to calm down and be more level headed about this.  Thank you for taking the time to read. =)  Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: 2 lumps found in left breast, having a hard time staying calm savvy107 Skigirl72
